videos.title: Overview Part 1
what_you_will_learn: The scope of Data Science.
The difference between AI, ML, and DL.
Real-world applications of Machine Learning.
videos.content_covered: This video provides a high-level overview of the entire field, setting the stage for the course. It explains what Data Science is and how Machine Learning fits into the broader ecosystem.

videos.title: Overview Part 2
what_you_will_learn: A simple end-to-end ML project.
The key steps in an ML workflow.
The role of data in training models.
videos.content_covered: A follow-up to the overview, this video gives a practical look at what a machine learning project entails, from data collection to model evaluation.

videos.title: Random Variables & Probability
what_you_will_learn: Defining Random Variables.
Understanding Probability Distributions.
Key concepts for statistical modeling.
videos.content_covered: Machine learning is built on a foundation of probability. This video covers the essential concepts of random variables and probability distributions.

videos.title: Expectation, Moments & CLT
what_you_will_learn: Calculating expectation.
Understanding moments like variance.
The importance of the Central Limit Theorem (CLT).
videos.content_covered: Dive deeper into statistical concepts critical for understanding ML algorithms, including expectation, variance, and the powerful Central Limit Theorem.

videos.title: Bayes' Theorem
what_you_will_learn: The formula for Bayes' Theorem.
The intuition behind conditional probability.
Updating knowledge with new evidence.
videos.content_covered: Bayes' Theorem is a cornerstone of ML, enabling us to update our beliefs in the face of new data. This video provides a clear explanation.

videos.title: Naïve Bayes Classifier
what_you_will_learn: The 'naïve' assumption.
Applying Bayes' theorem for classification.
Gaussian and other types of Naive Bayes.
videos.content_covered: The Naive Bayes classifier is a simple yet powerful algorithm for tasks like spam filtering. This video explains its mechanics and assumptions.

videos.title: Regression vs Classification
what_you_will_learn: The difference between predicting a number (regression) and a category (classification).
Identifying your problem type.
The Curse of Dimensionality.
videos.content_covered: This is a foundational concept in supervised learning, clearly distinguishing between the two main problem types.

videos.title: Bayesian Parameter Estimation
what_you_will_learn: The Bayesian approach to estimating parameters.
Differences from the frequentist approach.
Understanding posterior distributions.
videos.content_covered: This video introduces the Bayesian perspective, where parameters are treated as random variables with their own distributions.

videos.title: Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)
what_you_will_learn: The principle of MLE.
Finding parameters that maximize data likelihood.
Its relationship with cost functions.
videos.content_covered: MLE is a fundamental method for finding model parameters that make the observed data most probable.

videos.title: Maximum A Posteriori (MAP)
what_you_will_learn: How MAP combines MLE with a prior distribution.
The relationship between MAP, MLE, and Bayesian estimation.
When to use MAP over MLE.
videos.content_covered: MAP estimation is a Bayesian approach that incorporates prior knowledge, often leading to more regularized models.

videos.title: Gradient Descent & Regularisation
what_you_will_learn: The core idea of Gradient Descent.
Importance of learning rate and feature scaling.
What regularization is and why it's used.
videos.content_covered: Learn how most models are trained. This video explains the Gradient Descent algorithm and regularization for robust models.

videos.title: Linear Regression & Normal Equation
what_you_will_learn: The formula for the Normal Equation.
Solving for parameters analytically.
When this is preferred over Gradient Descent.
videos.content_covered: This video covers the Normal Equation, a direct, non-iterative method for finding the optimal parameters for linear regression.

videos.title: Logistic Regression Concepts
what_you_will_learn: How Logistic Regression is used for classification.
The role of the Sigmoid function.
Loss, convexity, and gradient descent for this model.
videos.content_covered: Logistic Regression is a go-to algorithm for binary classification. This video covers its core mathematical underpinnings.

videos.title: Logistic Regression: Multiclass
what_you_will_learn: Techniques like One-vs-Rest (OvR) to extend logistic regression.
How to handle problems with more than two classes.
The use of the Softmax function.
videos.content_covered: Learn how to adapt the binary Logistic Regression classifier to handle multiclass classification problems, where an instance can belong to one of three or more categories.

videos.title: SVM with Linear Kernel
what_you_will_learn: The core idea of finding the maximum-margin hyperplane.
The role of support vectors in defining the decision boundary.
How SVMs work for linearly separable data.
videos.content_covered: SVMs are a powerful class of supervised algorithms used for classification. This video introduces the fundamental concepts of SVMs for linear problems.

videos.title: SVM: Slack & Nonlinear Kernels
what_you_will_learn: How slack variables handle non-linearly separable data.
The concept of the 'kernel trick' for complex decision boundaries.
Understanding popular kernels like RBF and Polynomial.
videos.content_covered: Unlock the true power of SVMs by learning how they handle complex, real-world data using slack variables and the kernel trick, which maps data to higher dimensions.

videos.title: Introduction to Decision Trees
what_you_will_learn: How a decision tree makes predictions.
Concepts like root nodes, branches, and leaf nodes.
The idea of splitting data based on features.
videos.content_covered: Decision Trees are intuitive and interpretable models that mimic human decision-making. This video introduces the basic structure and logic of a decision tree classifier.

videos.title: Random Forest & Model Comparison
what_you_will_learn: What an ensemble model is.
How Random Forest improves on a single Decision Tree.
The concepts of bagging and feature randomness.
videos.content_covered: Learn about ensemble learning through Random Forests, a powerful model that combines multiple decision trees to produce more accurate and robust predictions.

videos.title: K-Means Clustering
what_you_will_learn: The goal of clustering: to find groups in unlabeled data.
The iterative algorithm behind K-Means.
How to choose the number of clusters (K).
videos.content_covered: This video introduces unsupervised learning with K-Means, one of the most popular clustering algorithms used to partition data into distinct, non-overlapping subgroups.

videos.title: Gaussian Mixture Models (GMM)
what_you_will_learn: How GMMs provide a probabilistic approach to clustering.
The difference between hard and soft clustering.
When to use GMMs over K-Means.
videos.content_covered: Go beyond K-Means with Gaussian Mixture Models, a more flexible clustering algorithm that assumes data points are generated from a mixture of several Gaussian distributions.

videos.title: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) Part 1
what_you_will_learn: The motivation for dimensionality reduction.
The goal of PCA: to find the directions of maximum variance.
The concept of principal components.
videos.content_covered: This video introduces Principal Component Analysis (PCA), a fundamental technique for dimensionality reduction that helps in data visualization and improving algorithm performance.

videos.title: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) Part 2
what_you_will_learn: How to implement PCA in practice.
Interpreting the results of PCA.
The difference between PCA and Linear Regression.
videos.content_covered: This second part of the PCA series delves into the practical implementation and interpretation, solidifying your understanding of this key unsupervised learning technique.

videos.title: Reinforcement Learning Intro
what_you_will_learn: The core concepts: agent, environment, state, action, reward.
How Reinforcement Learning differs from other learning types.
Potential applications like game playing and robotics.
videos.content_covered: This video provides an introduction to Reinforcement Learning, where an agent learns to make decisions by performing actions in an environment to maximize a cumulative reward.

videos.title: Big Data Technologies
what_you_will_learn: The challenges of working with Big Data.
Overview of key technologies like Hadoop and Spark.
The role of these technologies in the ML pipeline.
videos.content_covered: Machine Learning often involves massive datasets. This video introduces the field of Big Data and the technologies designed to store, manage, and process data at scale.
